website_summaries.verdict: Fitbit's Charge HR combines heart rate tracking, sleep tracking and fitness into an affordable, slim band with good battery life. It's a hard combination to beat.
pros: Works with Windows, iPhone and Android phones
Fitbit's massive popularity means you'll be able to join up and compete with friends
Connects with many third-party fitness apps
cons: Design and fit aren't ideal for glancing at heart rate
OLED display turns off after a few seconds, which gets annoying
Heart-rate coaching and goal-setting isn't intuitive

customer_reviews.title: one step forward, five steps back
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked this... but like all fitbit products, it has proven unfaithful. I have had to go through countlesss fitbits and they stop charging (known issue). ..the company replaced, but screen breaks. I assumed this must have been me, bought new one in march....but then screen broke again. according to forums, this is known issue. I was tired enough with fitbit when I got blaze and had to return it within one week due to no lock screen. but then, like charge issue,this keeps happening....I am through with this company. Promoted to military/patients alike, but ultimately a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: UnityT5

customer_reviews.title: Would not charge at first, then wouldn't hold the charge
customer_reviews.text: Was not able to use item for more than 2 hours. First the battery would not charge completely, then 2 hours later, the tracker shut down with dead battery warning. Contacted Fitbit, informed manufacturer defect. However, Fitbit customer service was prompt in helping me both times I contacted them over this item, and were quick with resolution in a timely manner. Compared to my experience here, that was a relief!
customer_reviews.author: HFN

customer_reviews.title: I love my Fitbit flex
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend. After returning it for her once because it stopped working, it stopped working again. I know she could get it replaced directly from Fitbit, but she hasn't bothered to take care of it because after breaking twice, who really has faith in the third one? A friend who works at a retail place that sells these says they're a nightmare and get returned all the time. I love my Fitbit flex, but the Charge and Charge HR just seem to be flawed. So dissapointing considering the price!
customer_reviews.author: K. Marie FrancesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of junk. After spending four hours doing everything they say is necessary to fix the sync/upgrade problem, I called Tech Support. After 45 minutes redoing everything I had done before, the tech support person, who was very nice and helpful, admitted that this is a known problem with the Fitbit Charge HR. In other words, it doesn't work, and the only way to get it to work is to do a software update if they ever figure out the problem, BUT, it won't do a software update. Without the sync, you can't keep any record of stats. So, it's just an uncomfortable and unsightly bracelet. Choose wisely Grasshopper. #REFUNDSFORCHARGEHR
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed......I've had my Fitbit Charge HR for just a year. It was replaced once after a month due to malfunction. Recently the back cover broke off and since it seems to me to be a defect, I assumed it would be replaced again since it's a defect in the construction.. Apparently I'm out of warranty and they will only offer a discount should I decide to purchase a new one. Not sure why I would purchase another if the company doesn't stand behind their product. Numerous other users have the same issue. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E Wood

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't hold a charge for very long
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new fit bit because my old one won't hold a charge. Then I got this one and discovered that it wouldn't hold a charge either. There are instructions on the website to "fix" that, and it does kinda work .... Now it holds a charge for maybe 12hrs instead of the 2 hrs it was lasting before I re-set it. That makes me think that there was nothing wrong with my old one. So if you're having battery trouble, "re-set" it; instructions are available on the Fit-Bit website.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the wristband is ridiculously poor. I enjoyed the functionality of the product just ...
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware!!! I bought this on April 14, 2016 and by the end of August 2016, the band was separating and no longer attractive to wear. The quality of the wristband is ridiculously poor. I enjoyed the functionality of the product just fine and would have paid more for something that might have lasted a reasonable amount of time. I would not recommend or purchase this item again. If you must consider it as an option, I recommend first googling "fitbit wristband falling apart" before buying to see that many others have had this problem. While the company may repair or replace mine, I have concluded it is junk I do not want to own.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Fitbit product. I started with a Flex and after it broke, I upgraded to the Charge HR. I'm not hard on them. I didn't sleep with either of them on, because they cause wrist pain. I didn't shower with them on either. My Flex stopped syncing and eventually would not hold a charge at all. The Charge HR had the same basic issue. After two months, it would no longer sync. I tried all the trouble shooting tips. I also contacted Fitbit, who was extremely unhelpful. I still carried it and manually entered my info, until the band broke on it. Fitbit products are junk. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Fit Bit Charge HR is not pairing/syncing
customer_reviews.text: This fit bit will not sync or pair up with the Fit Bit App on my electronic devices. I keep getting "Try again". Why I type in the 4 digit code and follow the instructions, the phone app is stuck on "Connecting". I tried this with the computer and Kindle Fire HD. I still get the same message. I may have to send this back if I can not pair the Fit Bit with a device. All devices do have the Blue Tooth capabilities. I just can't figure out why this will not sync up with my phone and other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This is a big disappointment. I had the Fitbit flex and then i bought the charge hr. As soon as I got it out of the box and charged I was disappointed. The batter was down to half life after only wearing it for about 5 hours and the stair count was completely off and when I called customer service about it they had the nerve to tell me it was misreading the elevation because of humidity. Well where I live is high humidity so how is it ever going to be accurate? It also didn’t track my sleep properly. Or anything else really.
customer_reviews.author: jaimee_ink

customer_reviews.title: Battery and customer service left wanting
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this version of Fitbit for many years. I am very disappointed in this Fitbit tho because the battery will not hold a charge at all. I’ve done everything I was supposed to via Fitbit help, the battery will not last longer than 24hrs. From day one, I’ve sent numerous emails to the company I purchased it from and they have not responded other than to keep asking me to give feedback.. so, yes Fitbit charge hr are typically phenomenal purchases, the ones from this seller with mine and other recent reviews will tell you that the battery is no longer good.
customer_reviews.author: J. mcphee

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working at 4 Months
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Fitbit. It was comfortable, it charged quickly, I was able to join friends on challenges, it kept me active. It did everything it was supposed to do until it didn't anymore - it just stopped charging, stopped syncing, and stopped working. I was able to use what I learned online to get it to charge again, but no matter how many steps I tried, I couldn't get it to sync to the app again, I couldn't change the time, and the step count was off. If you do buy this product, buy the support along with it just in case you have the same experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly D. Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Ughhh
customer_reviews.text: Literally all 3 of ours began to have different issues 3-5 months into ownership. Mine froze up while updating itself, and no troubleshooting tips from the company worked. My girlfriend's began to fall apart starting with the HR monitor coming loose, followed by the charging port falling apart. Our last one just very simply stopped working. Will not charge, will not turn on, will not display anything whatsoever. The reason I have given 3 stars instead of 1 is because they have replaced 2 of the 3. I am still waiting for response on mine. Customer service seems to be good, however I really don't want to have to talk to them every few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jake J.

customer_reviews.title: DONT FALL FOR IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to have finally saved up to purchase my very first Fitbit HR. Everything worked fine for a week. Then I began noticing it would not want to sync. I have since tried everything in the book to try to get it to sync but to no success. Ive literally had the watch for 1 and a half month and it is worthless. I contacted the seller to see if I could return the product for a refund but that was unsuccessful too! Save your money and purchase something that is worth it (not defective)!
customer_reviews.author: egrefhuao

customer_reviews.title: The HR has issues...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 weeks ago and was so excited to receive. Worked well for a few days then stopped keeping correct time and wouldn't sync to my device. I have two friends who also purchased one recently and they have the same issues. If you go on fitbit site, they state that they are aware of the problem specific to Charge HR and are working to resolve it. I am choosing to return mine while I can. I don't need a $150 pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Fitbit Charge HR I've purchased. Neither kept a charge for longer than 3 days and both basically fell apart and quit working after a year. I did wear it all the time (except in the shower) but isn't that the point? When I contacted the seller/manufacturer about my second one because it wouldn't "accept" a charge, I was told a replacement would be sent. It wasn't. This product isn't worth the price or the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Welker

customer_reviews.title: Like it but the recharge wire that comes with the watch is crap (why so short????).
customer_reviews.text: I like to wear it ... when and if I remember to put it on. The charging wire is so short I have it plug into the outlet (length of your hand from palm to fingers give or take anther 1-2 cm) and since it's there and not visible, I forget to wear the fitbit just about 3-4 days out of the week. Not sure if fitbit is trying to save money but if customer not wearing, what's the point? I give it a 4 stars when I'm wearing it and 2 stars because of the charging (because I'm not wearing it). Average 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tu V. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great product but it started breaking in 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Fitbit Charge HR for About 3 months and it already isn't working. I have used it daily and loved it. In the past week, the light blue clip that fits over the heart rate sensor became loose and when disconnecting the FitBit from the charger it came off. For a few days I worked it back on and the results were fine. Not happy with the fact it came loose, but I could live with it. Now it doesn't consistently read my heart rate and the data is k consistent. This is way too expensive of a purchase to have this kind of quality.
customer_reviews.author: J Len

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts less than an hour.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. The charge lasts less than an hour. I followed the instructions on the package. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit doesn't seem to care. Won't hold charge; useless.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Fitbit -- no issues with the previous purchases. Setting up this new Charge HR -- site provided code and charged ...but the charge was drained/gone in one hour. I charged again, this time it last six hours. I tried to update the settings (ie, time/date display) -- and the application site would not recognize the Fitbit. I emailed Fitbit -- and NO reply. I would rate this negative three stars, if that were an option!
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Ealy

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, easily synced it to my phone and ...
customer_reviews.text: Got as a replacement for the one I've had for two years but whose band broke. Easy setup, easily synced it to my phone and having no issues. Seems to be pretty accurate as long as your arm is moving with your steps. Walking around grocery store pushing cart does not count steps. Walking on a treadmill when holding onto bar will not count steps but you can add those steps within the app. The pulse tracker matches what I get at the doctor's office. I like this one much more than other activity trackers that friends or co-workers may use.
customer_reviews.author: Marie T.

customer_reviews.title: Second Fitbit to fail in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Fitbit less than 9 months and it's malfunctioning. I bought it to replace a previously-purchased Fitbit that did the same thing. During a routine walk, it quit working. I took it home and looked up troubleshooting guidance. I reset the Fitbit and it restarted, but then it quit accepting a full charge and consequently would not last through a single day. I've now purchased 2 of these (similar) Fitbits in the past two years and they've both failed during light or normal usage. I like their fitness application and when the devices work, they do what they are designed for, but their UNRELIABILITY is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mashburn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype..... there are better products out there that sell for much less money.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but I'm very disappointed that it's not waterproof like my garmin vivofit is. Also the battery on this doesn't last very long and it's a pain to have to charge it all the time. The battery on the garmin is supppsed to last a year or so and it's still going strong after 8 months of use. I'm surprised that the fitbits haven't incorporated a better longer lasting battery yet. I bought this for my son with his birthday money and he's been rather disappointed with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, Expensive, Not Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well as a step and sleep counter. The heart rate function worked as long as I wasn't exercising- even when I had it further up my arm as they suggest. It stopped working two weeks after its warranty was up, and the company sent me an email apologizing saying they couldn't fix it as they had "grown so big they couldn't help everyone." I wonder if there was some language issue as the customer service rep I spoke to also had some difficulty with English and was, frankly, quite rude. This ended up costing about $12/month. Quite expensive. They did offer me 25% off my next purchase. Frankly I don't think it's worth it. Trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Moksha

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, simple, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great purchase. I bought this for my husband who was interested in tracking his steps, calories burned, and his heart rate while working out. He doesn't normally like to wear watches because they feel bulky and heavy to him, but this Fitbit is small, sleek, and light weight. Its perfect work wourkouts and wearing to work. The all black is great because it doesn't stand out and doesn't attract attention. It is also very easy to figure out. The watch comes with directions to help you understand how it works and how to sync it with your phone. I would definitely recommend this for someone who needs a simple workout/calorie tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Tori LenellTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and it would not sync to a device. The lights flash when you first set it up but then it never turns on or syncs. We called FitBit support and they confirmed something was wrong with the product, and offered to send us a replacement. The replacement was a different type of fitbit, bigger and clunkier and had the same issue. Upon doing some research online, the software version has known issues that do exactly what mine are. Now the return window has closed and I am stuck with 2 useless fitbits that no one can use. Super disappointed, don;t waste your $70.
customer_reviews.author: S. O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Charge HR is great to use - when it syncs properly
customer_reviews.text: Charge HR is great to use - when it syncs properly. Unfortunately, it doesn't sync properly. For the past week or so I've been unable to sync my Charge HR via Bluetooth. I've tried rebooting my Charge HR, uninstalling and reinstalling the Fitbit app, removing/readding the Charge HR via the app...all to no avail. This has wasted a lot of my time; time that could have been spent working out instead of trying to fix a silly technical problem on an inferior product. So essentially, this product is a $120 stopwatch.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Y Huang

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: AM Extremely disappointed in this. Have had it 3 days now and it WILL NOT connect to my Samsung Galaxy S4. Have tried everything SEVERAL times that are listed in the forums and Help Center. Will connect to my computer, but the Fitbit App on the computer does not have the Challenges, etc. Plus, the steps and miles do not tally up. AND the stairs flights is a joke. ie. Yesterday I walked 2 miles (according to my SHealth) on this thing it was 7 flights of stairs, over 10,000 steps! Glad I purchased it from Amazon, sending it back today!
customer_reviews.author: Mary. B

customer_reviews.title: Hated the FitBit charge HR
customer_reviews.text: Hated the FitBit charge HR!! The battery needed charged every 2-3 days, it took forever to charge, and often would not charge when plugged in. It is NOT accurate as a fitness tracker! I could be standing still, not moving just breathing and I would rack up several hundred "steps". This tracker also has limited functionality compared to the Garmin Vivosmart HR...which is a much more accurate tracker that is waterproof. I hated everything about it and will stick with Garmin in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of hype with little to back it up
customer_reviews.text: After owning the Fitbit for over a year I would rate it at two stars. They start to fall apart rather quickly after very light use (not everyday wear and no rough workouts). Compatibility with apps besides the Fitbit app is lacking, there are many other devices that are very open to communication with most fitness apps out there. The battery life is terrible!! My Fitbit needs to get charged at least every day. It was very disappointing to have one of the three Fitbits I bought go bad at just a little over a year. If buying a fitness tracker, I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jose N. Morales

customer_reviews.title: I see reviews and comparisons to other products - but ...
customer_reviews.text: I see reviews and comparisons to other products - but unless you are hooked up to a machine in a doctor's office the reading you get from any wristband is going to be "...ish". I find that my FitBit is consistent. I even wear it at Crossfit and I sweat A LOT. I've noticed throughout the week that the readings are consistent - and that's what I need. Comparable results - even if it may not be 100% accurate. This keeps me accountable. I even take the stairs more often at work because if I have a FitBit - I want as many steps and flights as possible throughout the day!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Brockman

customer_reviews.title: Got broken within a year and seven months
customer_reviews.text: I used two Fitbit products. This one lasted for a year and seven months. The other one lasted a year and two months. They got broken in the end in one way or the other. I did not use it in challenging environment in any sense... no scuba diving, no hang gliding. Just house choirs and driving to supermarkets. Fitbit has very high reputation but now I am VERY skeptical about their product quality. Much cheaper Lintelek has been doing well nearly two years. I would buy Lintelek and not Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: matao

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Time, Not the Charm
customer_reviews.text: I loved this device, but it started falling apart. The back piece that the charger charges into broke off. Fitbit replaced it, then the same thing happened, it started falling apart. I bought another one on Amazon, it just happened again! Fitbit informed me, that I could get a 25% discount on a newer more expensive model, or 40% off discount on their most expensive model. It excludes all of their latest models. My advice, find a different brand to get used to, then start with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nile

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't  accurately  count  stairs.
customer_reviews.text: I compared ny fitbit to my samsung app.. the differece was about 300 steps more in my fitbit. I went to vegas and it was nothing but walking and going up and down stair. My fitbit on registered on 10 stairs.. and I know for sure it was more than that because all scalators at vegas were out of service. It was raining and about 3 am. That is why im rating it 4 stars. Other than that I like it.
customer_reviews.author: 😁😁😁😁 nz

customer_reviews.title: Challenge accepted!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to slowly challenge myself more and more to be more active. I used to be a geologist, always hiking around. And now an office chump. And I had no idea the calorie burn difference between a field grunt and office chump. I feel like there ought to be more dynamic sizes instead of S/M and L/XL. I have a rather bony and small set of wrists and still had to buy L/XL. It's just the same as shopping at American Eagle where they only sell extra smalls and feeling like a whale. Just sayin'
customer_reviews.author: jbird

customer_reviews.title: Such a gem!
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear this every day! I almost forgot I had it until I started doing all my amazon reviews I’ve been slacking on! It has a heart rate monitor, which was the main (and only) reason I purchased one. I really enjoy the design of this, especially how the band clips together. The display is crystal clear and easy to use. Really easy to set up with your phone. I’d never had a Fitbit before, but I do not regret purchasing this one in the slightest. I’d show more in the picture, but the battery is currently dead. Now I’ll be sure to charge it up for tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: It Works Fine For a Year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this end of May, 2016 with doubts on longevity. Just after a year, the wristband started to come undone. Now, Sept 2017, it will only hold a charge for a day. It was out of warranty the day it started falling apart. I will not be spending $130 on a watch every year, or calling support (period). I expect technological devices to fail, but not right after a year. It's okay overall. The charge HR keeps track of average heart rate. If you dig deep, it will tell you your cardio level for the day. RECOMMENDATION: Don't buy unless you're to lazy to keep a timer when you're doing cardio, or don't feel like spending $130/yr.
customer_reviews.author: Jjames

customer_reviews.title: Two items defective, bad lot of FitBits
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two FitBit Charge units from this seller. Both had the same defect: they would not hold a battery charge beyond 8-12 hours. This model should hold a charge for 8 days with normal use. I know I did not receive the same unit twice, because I ordered the second one even before returning the first. So this appears to be a bad lot of FitBits, whether that is because they are knock-offs, reconditioned items, or just damaged, I do not know. I would avoid purchasing from this seller in any case.
customer_reviews.author: FullmoonCat

customer_reviews.title: Loved this Fitbit while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I received some sort of warranty but this thing didn't even last 6 months. It started malfunctioning by the time being wrong and wouldn't connect for it to fix which was strange, I had to go in and change the clock display for the time to correct itself. Then one day it died and I put it on the charger (as I normally would) and it has forever stayed on the charging display since. It's disappointing because this bracelet did help me with fitness journey a whole lot and I love the app that goes with it but for how much I payed, it shouldn't have malfunctioned as fast as it did
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: It won't last very long.
customer_reviews.text: I can only speak for the Charge HR, but after some time, it will stop syncing, requiring a full reset/wipe every few days, which means you have to stay on top of its syncing. If you don't, when you wipe it, you'll lose all the data since the last time you synced it. There also don't seem to be any more firmware updates available for this device. It will not sync via phone OR computer which has explained it's an issue with the device, not the phone or computer. I'd advise at least getting another model, if not a different brand entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Product received in damaged  re-taped box and does not work,
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit arrived inside a box not damaged. The fitbit box was damaged and re-taped. The hard plastic stand was broken in a number of pieces. Would not sinc with my iphone. On the phone with fitbit for over a hour with support trying numerous things to try to sinc. The fitbit looked okay but obiviously it did not work. Fitbit sent me a return label to send back to them and they would replace it. I don't feel they should have to do that but was nice of them. I don't feel I should have to pay for this damaged. product.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Battery?
customer_reviews.text: This Fitbit works pretty well. It auto recognizes workouts such as walks, runs, aerobic workout, etc. Although it gets them confused sometimes and doesn't record it correctly so calories burned isn't as accurate as it could be. Also, my biggest complaint is that I have my auto-sync off, also all day sync is off and my battery life is barely 24 hours. I have to charge it every night. Otherwise it's a pretty good piece of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Patience First
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, had a bunch of trouble setting this one up. Finally called tech support and they were incredibly patient. It took a bit, but we finally found the source of the problem was too many blue tooth watches in the same room 8-) It appears that all is well now and Javier in support deserves kudos for his understanding as we worked through it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, however after almost a year the band started to come apart at the screen. Fitbit issued me a replacement and 8 months after being given a replacement the replacement has started to fall apart and crack at where the band meets the screen. I want to love this but the longevity of this product makes me give it 3 stars. The app is great, and it tracks all my stats wonderfully when it isn't falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: This particular fitbit does not hold its charge at all
customer_reviews.text: I've had this model fitbit before and it was great. My previous one was orange and I only paid $40 something for it on Amazon. It was great. It would hold a charge for 3-4 days. I had to get a new one because (1) the orange color showed dirt/grim even when I cleaned the band and it started to come apart. But, I felt I got my money's worth because it was so inexpensive. This one I paid $109 for and from day one it wouldn't hold a charge for even a full 8 hours. It is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: A good fitness tool to help you reach your goals each day
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Fitbit for years and really like it. The only problem is the rubber will break down after a while and the pieces will separate. The warranty through Fitbit is really good and they will replace it once, but when that one goes you have to be a new one. Had an HR Charge, then the HR Charge 2, then went back to the HR Charge purely for cost reasons. Still couldn't tell you the difference. Both give you your heart rate and count steps. The battery charge will last a good four or five days, but I find if I charge every other day the step counting is more accurate. Fitbit's dashboard has really good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian R

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit too inaccurate to measure fitness
customer_reviews.text: I ditched my Fitbit after realizing that it wasn't recording most of my fitness activity. I once hit my step goal at 4am, while I was sleeping! Then it wouldn't accurately track my heart rate for anything over 120bpm. So, my calorie output was skewed because my fitness time was incorrect. I would be on a treadmill with a HR of 145, and my Fitbit would say 110-115... if it recorded anything at all (apparently sweat makes it malfunction). And there was no accurate way to measure weight lifting as an exercise because of the HR issue. So what good is a fitness tracker that can't accurately monitor fitness?
customer_reviews.author: J. Healis

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd never bought it.
customer_reviews.text: I wore a Fitbit One for several years and really liked it. Simple, discrete and functional. Then a friend convinced me to upgrade to the Charge HR to wear during my international travels. I bought it a month before a left and it never functioned correctly. Sometimes it tracked, sometimes it didn't. It didn't maintain the correct time. So I left it behind and went abroad for almost six months. Took it out to give it another try and it's worse than ever. My computer doesn't recognize it, it won't sync to my phone. Totally waste of money. And now I find out it's too late to return the damn thing.
customer_reviews.author: Docta Puella

customer_reviews.title: Dies in a day.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Fitbit to keep track of my steps. And it does, seemingly accurately. It's also fun to see your heart rate. However, it only held a charge for about 12 hours instead of the 5 days that it is supposed to. I'd even be ok with charging every couple of days but to not even last a single day is unacceptable. I'm getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Dark skin no no
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product a higher rating however it has a flaw. The darker your skin the less likely you are to get a constant heart rate reading. I am on my second one because at first I thought it was a malfunctioning product. However this is the second one and same issue. I have to literally have the band on so tight that it leaves the heart rate module impression on my skin to get a reading. It makes sense because they use light to get the reading through your skin. I wish there was a disclaimer but there is none.
customer_reviews.author: N. Cornwall

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Charge HR battery is a problem
customer_reviews.text: I got my first fitbit charge hr on June 6 2015. Loved it, battery lasted 5 days+ on continuous synch. In Dec the cover for the charging housing separated from the band. Fitbit replaced it graciously within a matter of days. The replacement fitbit couldn't hold a charge for 2 days. Again fitbit replaced it graciously within a few days. This second replacement also doesn't hold a charge for more than 2 days on manual sync! They must have changed their battery supplier since I had my first one. Other new fitbit users at my gym report battery problems. Don't buy now until battery problem fixed.
customer_reviews.author: CaryO

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck in the Fitbit lineup
customer_reviews.text: This thing keeps me on my toes and makes me want to break my own records as well as my friends I'm competing against. Sometimes my wrist will start to hurt/sweat when I have it on for long periods at a time and I do not sleep with it at all. Another thing I notice is the battery life seems to decrease after the first two months of having it. I would normally go about 5 days in a single charge and now i'm down to 3 days. Overall the device is great, it reads everything from heart rate and steps.
customer_reviews.author: Artie Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: ... is a preliminary review as so far I'm not happy got this last night plugged it in when I
customer_reviews.text: This is a preliminary review as so far I'm not happy got this last night plugged it in when I. Went to bed at around 9pm woke up at around 2 am to use the restroom and it said it was fully charged so I put it on and went back to sleep by 5 am as I can was getting ready for work I looked at the app and it is saying that the battery is already at medium this is supposed to last 5 days on one change and in 3 hours mine dropped by almost half going to give it a few days before trying to get a replacement or refund

customer_reviews.title: What a waste!!! Stopped charging in less than 4Mons.
customer_reviews.text: My fitbit was working until today. It doesn't turn on, won't even charge. Now I can't even return because the 30 day window is closed. Overall I thought the product is at least acceptable since whenever my battery drains I will have big time syncing problems when I turn it back on (it gets stuck and I'll have to do multiple attempts to correct date and time, sometimes I'll have to connect and disconnet device just to make it work with my iphone). Now all hopes are gone, ~$30 for each month I used it. Just wow.. 😢
customer_reviews.author: Luggage space conscious ✈️

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. The biggest flaw to these is that you ...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. The biggest flaw to these is that you can not change the band. After 6 months the rubber is separating on mine and my wife's just fell apart after 5 months. On her's the back fell off that holds the push button in place. Update: Mine stopped working completely after about 9 months. My wife's won't hold a charge and the backing plate and button fell off. She has to use a rubber-band to hold it in place just to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: WET

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit warranty service is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This is an update review that I moved up a star. The activity tracker stopped charging after a few months. After a lot of emails and time, I finally got a replacement tracker. I had to provide receipt and provide activity account number. I am not sure what they are looking for.to proof it is indeed THE tracker that's bought and under warranty period. The Fitbit warranty service is a nightmare. Since they finally sent a replacement, I moved from one star to two star.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lin

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if the entire product line is like this by the charge HR is truly a piece ...
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely unhappy with the Charge HR. I am on my 3rd warranted unit and it still has issues syncing. The units work for a few months then stops working. To FitBits credit they quickly send out a new unit, but am I supposed to keep getting new units every 3 months? I don't know if the entire product line is like this by the charge HR is truly a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: DCwom

customer_reviews.title: Works but does not wear well BUT they replaced it!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised but mine is now a year old and the plastic cover is falling off. I am 71 years old so it certainly is not from excessive use! I was contacted by Fitbit concerning the 1st 2 sentences in this review. After some discussion they are replacing my Fitbit. As my Fitbit was out of the 1 year warranty I am extremely pleased that after they considered my circumstances they were willing to replace my Fitbit. The result is Fitbit made an unhappy customer very happy. That is about as much as one can expect from a manufacture when there is an issue. So I have changed my review from 3 to 5.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a few months
customer_reviews.text: I am super disappointed... the fitbit was great for about 4 months and then the band started to come apart and on either side of the face, and then bubbles of air formed under the rubber. I have had quite the time getting it replaced and/or repaired. I bought the protection plan and cannot even get in touch with SquareTrade protection plan. Bummed out that I spent the money...wished it was higher quallity. One plus is that Fitbit is replacing my Charge hr.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sidell

customer_reviews.title: Burn & Shock
customer_reviews.text: During the past several months I have had to take it off at night. I have been burnt twice and now I'm st the point i'm going to contact the fitbit company because of the health issues. It was fully charged when I put on and it's the end of the day and its dead. this fitbit burned me twice. This item isn't holding a charge I want to return. refund please Don't buy a refurbishment fitbit
customer_reviews.author: faith

customer_reviews.title: Defective Fitbit Charge HR
customer_reviews.text: People please listen: Do NOT buy this product. Yes I'm serious. Got mine super fast at an awesome price, but guess what? It's defective! It over counts your steps, like 100-200 more steps, it's completely inaccurate. Fitbit.com offers no help on this issue. If you google FitBit Charge HR glitch, you can read the forums for yourself. I don't know if it's just this particular Fitbit product that is exsperienci good this glitch, but please be warned and save your money. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit gives Me Health and Sleep Updates!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I managed my health without it!!!! I really love the feedback I get and how it helps me keep to my schedule of working out! I guess if I could change anything it would be to be able to change the color of the band with the outfit that I'm wearing but it doesn't stop me from wearing it all the time. The best feedback is to be able to see how much sleep I'm getting and to tailor my activities the next day depending on the amount of sleep I get...
customer_reviews.author: Michele A. Polselli

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: Order was received on time and in original packaging. Item worked well when plugged in to charge. Connected to the Fitbit app easily. Attempted to charge for hours to see if the battery was just low, but it never held a charge. As soon as it was unplugged from the USB it would shut off instantly. When plugged back in a battery with an exclamation point icon appeared followed by a full battery indicator. Amazon graciously refunded this purchase to me without needing to return due to faulty item. Purchase with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Patterson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item 365 days plus 65 days past the 'limited' manufacturer warranty. The product is poorly constructed. The band began to bubble and pull away from the tracking device. I contacted Fitbit and sent pictures of the device. They said that my purchase was out of warranty and offered a 25% discount on another purchase. I declined as I do not intend to spend good money after bad. One mistake is enough. For the record, I am a senior citizen. I took good care of the tracker, never got it wet and followed instructions for its care. Future buyers would be well advised to read customer comments before purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elinor M

customer_reviews.title: Lets start off by saying I love what this product does
customer_reviews.text: Lets start off by saying I love what this product does, I was able to lose 6lbs by actively tracking my progress. It worked well for about 11 months then the band starts to break away from the housing. Here is the kicker try finding an address or phone number to return the item that is covered by the 1 yr warranty. Although I could find warranty links on the website, you will click yourself into frustrating circles. The paperwork that came with the item was not much help either. If you buy this product plan on buying a new one yearly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Heembrock

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Fitbit and upon their mandatory firmware update it 2017, it bricked. Totally useless. I used it on and off over 2 years. Fitbit customer service was great and replaced it for free with the Charge 2. That one broke (tracks steps but no longer visible on screen) after 3 months and they said replacements are only covered for 30 days. They offered me 25% off a new device. Not planning to purchase from Fitbit again since I’ve had two devices break in under 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: It works but don’t buy unless you or the recipient speaks Japanese. Box and instructions were not in English. Update: my mil gave it back to me saying she could not get it to work. We have attempted to troubleshoot and figure out how to get this item working but it does not. I lowered my star rating and highly warn anyone who is thinking about buying this Fitbit from this seller to go buy it somewhere else. This is a SCAM!
customer_reviews.author: Meoconnor32

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: I work a desk job and really needed something to remind me to MOVE more. I would have preferred the new fitbit which has some beautiful bands you can customize it with as this one is very blah looking, but this one has the heart rate monitor which I really need so I went with it. Other than the blah appearance it works well and has some nice features. I appreciate that it counts my steps on the elliptical and the app is easy to use.My favorite feature is the sleep tracking and my biggest gripe is the battery life. I feel like I am always having to charge it and at the most inconvenient times.
customer_reviews.author: Keli

customer_reviews.title: multi-purpose watch
customer_reviews.text: I like to wear this everyday as a watch and to also let me know if I have phone calls coming when I am in the middle of work or class. The fact it also tracts steps and heart rate is another bonus. I recently had to order a new one because my older one snapped after long term use. The one I received ended up having a defective battery, but the fitbit customer service was very helpful in getting me a new one. Overall I do like this product.
customer_reviews.author: breanna

customer_reviews.title: Works ok mostly, sometimes glitchy and poor design around charging port.
customer_reviews.text: Works good most the time...has a few glitches where it will sometimes not count steps or heartrate correctly. The major issue is that the back cover cracked and broke off where the charging port is. I had to Gorilla glue it back on twice now to keep the charging cable attached in order for it to charge. Rather disappointed in lack of quality for how much this thing cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mac131

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I like what my Fitbit does. I can keep track of my activity and runs, makes it fun. However, my first one started falling apart within a month. They did have good customer service and replaced it. Now, on my second one, 7 months later, it is falling apart again. They are not durable. For $125.00 I was hoping it would last a couple of years....guess not. So, if it wasn't for the customer service and the activity tracking, I'd give it one star. I'm going to see if they will replace this second one. I will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: According to this Fitbit I die after 1st 5 minutes of workout. Don’t buy for HR feature.
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent HR monitoring. Got this solely for HR monitor for interval training. Just about the only time it worked was in first 5 minutes of workout and even then only the peaks. Tried both wrists in different spots and snugness -per the manual yet couldn’t get consistent readings. Super pissed I can’t return it. Expected more from Fitbit. Certainly my last purchase from them.
customer_reviews.author: JPWTrojan

customer_reviews.title: Initially amazing, shows use quickly
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of use, I'm hooked. I only wish the battery life was closer to the suggested 5 days. Hopefully it's a bug that can be remedied through the Fitbit update. UPDATE: I've worn the fitbit HR avg 6 days a week for 5 months now. The tracking is great. Not entirely sure if it's truly accurate, but it's consistent so I'm happy. Battery life is greatly improved by turning off constant updates. Cons so far... the band has pulled away from the top of screen, bubbled below and it gets dirty quickly. It's really not attractive anymore. Pictures soon.
customer_reviews.author: TQ

customer_reviews.title: The app is very easy to use and really keeps you on track
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the bomb! I bought it in December and have been using it to track activity and calorie intake. The app is very easy to use and really keeps you on track. I've lost 24 pounds since I've been using it and am really convinced that I couldn't have done it without the constant feedback and access to activity info. My only beef is the food database really needs to be cleaned up and updated, and the exercise tracking app will crash on iPhone 4S if you try to take a photo while using the GPS logging part. Oh and they really need to make this thing waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Jones

customer_reviews.title: The Charge HR is Convenient, Comfortable, Social, SUPERB!
customer_reviews.text: The Charge HR is durable, comfortable, and easy to use. That it automatically discerns when the wearer is awake or sleeping is awesome, and the PC Web and Android Mobile Apps are incredible! The interface is super intuitive, with a default dashboard that readably displays all of your relevant personal fitness data. I'm only beginning to explore the social components of the FitBit app, but I wish I'd started using all of this years ago...I guarantee I'd be in better shape today if I'd had these convenient (and ever-present) fitness -awareness and -motivation tools. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: J. RASBACH

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect it to last
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of fitbits over the last several years and have found they invariably fail due to quality issues,. In latest one , the Charge HR, the face has separated from the battery compartment and the Fitbit won’t take a charge any longer. A call to Fitbit resulted in them telling me I could buy a new Fitbit at a 25% discount as the one in question was out of warranty. My advice being if you don’t want a Fitbit it to last more than a year then go ahead and purchase one, however, if you would like it to last any longer then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: R1Z2

customer_reviews.title: WARNING RETURN THIS PRODUCT IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! WARNING! As soon as you discover that your device does not work as promised you must return it immediately. If they can trick you into "trying adjustments to fit or use" for 30 days AFTER SHIPPING you are stuck and neither Amazon nor Fitbit will accept the return or honor the warranty. This is a highly defective product and you do not want to get stuck with it. Again, RETURN THIS PRODUCT IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Floyd

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed in my Hr Charge
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in my Hr Charge. It is completely falling apart. the band is coming apart and the display box is coming apart also. This is not what I expected. I only wear it as a watch, I take it off every night, just like I would my watch and charge it every two days. It is still working , but it want be much good to me when the device has completely fallen apart. I purchased my charge May 20. 2016. I have had it 8 months. I'm 50 years old, not an athletic type, never do anything strenuous ,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad but overall worth the purchase to a healthy lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item concerned by mixed reviews. I will start by saying I love the heart rate monitor. It's not high tech but I don't need spot on numbers. I never really know my rest heart rate st and this does great to tell me sat what level of exertion I'm working at= score! Thee band is horrible. It hurts! The plastic is just really digging into my skin :( however on previous suggestions I purchased mole skin and lifted the inside of my Fitbit and it's way better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it no stars...
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's fine but often the heartrate monitor is all of the place (like north of 200 beats! per minute even when its really not). Also the band is garbage. I had a replacement at 5 months and now less than a year later, the band is bubbling and falling apart and the "best" fitbit could do was offer me a 25% discount on a new product because "as a global company they have to be consistent in their policies" (i.e. can't admit they created a faulty product or they might go out of business). A quick search online or even on their own Fitbit Community Discussions will show hundreds and hundreds of messages with these issues.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a ripoff! My wife has been wearing it for around a year, just out of warranty, and it is falling apart. Poor design, poor manufacturing and dishonest advertising. I can only say I hope you have better luck if you spend your hard earned money on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: wingman

customer_reviews.title: No iOS Health Support!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe you guys won't allow your device to sync with iOS Health! Every other app feeds off of Health and contributes its own data, everyone shares data to make the apps work flawlessly together. Then Fitbit comes along and doesn't support it so now my running, biking, etc apps can't receive heart rate data or anything else from the Fitbit Charge HR! The Map My Ride app connects to the Fitbit website, but I haven't seen any data being shared with it since connecting. I definitely can not see my current heart rate or anything while on a ride.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Well it was great for the little time it lasted. Fitbit notified me of an os update so I clicked on it to download the update. Bad move because the Fitbit is totally worthless now! Don’t know what to do with it because you can’t wear it for jewelry and it cost too damn much to throw in a drawer and forget. I advise people do not purchase something you can’t update. Total waste if money!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C D Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these just arent there and I think fitbit knows it. I have went through 3 of these so far and a lot of the people that I work with has had the same issues. They wear out really quick (the rubber) the button wears quick. Fitbit seems to know this because they replace them very easily. I feel like when you call them, they already know the product is pretty bad, so they just replace them with little questions asked. The social aspect of fitbit cannot be matched from any of its competitors so it is worth keeping them around. Just be aware that it could break within a few months.
customer_reviews.author: TheMcclaneShow

customer_reviews.title: This product is junk. When it functions, it ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. When it functions, it did what it was supposed to. The problem is, this thing never lasts more than a couple months at a time. I've had it replaced three times now, and it's broken again, and now they're refusing to fix it. This time the tracker actually made it four months before breaking. I'll never buy another fit bit again.
customer_reviews.author: A. and R. Rechtien

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart 3 times.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, but the band separated from the tracker three times. The first two times, Fitbit replaced it. The third time, I just threw it away. I'm a mostly-sedentary office worker, so if it can't survive me, then something is truly wrong with it. Apparently the newer Fitbits have all sorts of problems, too. A darn shame, because I really want a Fitbit, but I need one that works and can survive more than a few months of very light use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy two and expect about a year... almost exactly.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked paying $130 for a watch that lasted less than a year. THEN I bought a smaller size replacement (the old one stopped fitting after it died). The second Fitbit lasted less than 2 months. I can see one failing and I can think “maybe I just got a bad one” but when I get two in a row and they seem to get progressively worse in quality, I can’t. I really want to call garbage here. $260 got two watches that together lasted less than one year.
customer_reviews.author: Angie B

customer_reviews.title: third fitbit device to fail in less than year
customer_reviews.text: i've three fitbit device in three years. each has failed the same way where the battery life gets shorter until it won't hold a charge for even a day and then craps out entirely. This most recent one was bought in december and it's only lasted 6 months before failing. it is theoretically under warranty but i have pay the postage to send it back and wait who knows how long to get it back. i'm not sure it's worth the hassle to claim the warranty. It would be nice to have a product that actually lasted two or three years.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: It broke in 75 days, then it was replaced.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the Fitbit Charge HR. I loved the thing, and then it broke after 2.5 months. The warranty (limited) is indecipherable. It was only returnable for 45 days. So mine lasted 30 days after that. The backing fell off, I can no longer recharge it, and it is worthless to me at this point. I am extremely disappointed. UPDATE: In response to this review Fitbit contacted me and sent me a brand new Fitbit. That earns a lot of points in my book. I changed my rating from 1 to 3 stars. If my new fitbit lasts, and does not break, I will edit this to a higher rating again.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Foubert

customer_reviews.title: Serious software problem.
customer_reviews.text: The Charger HR worked fine for 5 months but started losing time and won't sync to iPhone app. Fitbit customer support has been aware of this problem from early December 2015 but has come up with no solution but to re-install the software. This apparently only works sometimes, and the problems starts all over again. The Fitbit Community Forum is full of complaints.
customer_reviews.author: CMTGeorgia

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery with good condition. Quality is good & function is good ...
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery with good condition. Quality is good & function is good enough for me. Exactly measure of heartbeat & calories, comparing with FT40, I have read some complaints about its exactness but maybe they don't wear it in correct way, and we have to accept some tolerance anyway, what we input for food is also not 100% correct... so just know draftly how much calories in & out of our body and balance nutrition, health must come first... enjoy life buddies <3 UPDATE: I threw away this stuff after 9-month-use, the plastic parts are broken out, my watch became 3 separated parts :(
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: This our 3rd Fitbit....it will last you one year!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Charge HR. I wear mine all the time and after the first one fell apart I figured it was just a fluke. So I bought another one. Same thing only different. The first one mechanically came apart. And the this one the heart rate just stopped working(and sleep tracking - not sure if they are related). I called Fitbit and they were very nice, but after much trouble shooting and emails I was offered 25% off another one. It's not worth paying $130 for a new one each year. FYI - my wife's Fitbit also lasted about one year.
customer_reviews.author: D. C Frezza

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Fitbit product. I loved this for the first couple of months, and had no major issues, but now the band is coming loose! It's frustrating because if you spend over 100 dollars for a product, you do NOT expect it to start falling apart after less than a year. I will say it seems to keep pretty accurate count of my steps throughout the day (I've checked with friends when we spend the day together and they have their own trackers) or running on the treadmill, I'll keep mile splits. I don't know how I feel about purchasing another one, if it falls apart again. I previously had the One and regret upgrading to this one.
customer_reviews.author: P Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: I actually like the item even though the tightest setting is already ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought XL and it fits only on the tightest notch. I'm losing more weight so Fitbit will be much too big. Based on sizing info, the L right now would be too small on the loosest notch so what does Fitbit expect me to do...buy 2? It seems they dropped the ball on this one and forgot an in between size...they could have at least put more notches for tightening on the XL. I actually like the item even though the tightest setting is already loosening on me. It's unfortunate that they didn't think this through.
customer_reviews.author: NewfPyr

customer_reviews.title: Great motivational device
customer_reviews.text: I love my fitbit. I have a very hard time staying motivated to workout, and this little fitness tracker really works for me. Once you download the app, you can add friends and compete with them, which is really motivating for me. You can also track your steps, calories burned, floors climbed, heart rate, and sleep cycles. It also has a long battery life, and charges really quickly. I plug mine into my laptop once every few days, and it's done charging in twenty minutes. Pros: Tracks sleep Long battery life Very motivating Durable Cons: Not waterproof Can't change band A bit bulky (in my opinion. I have a small wrist, and this just looks big on my arm)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Besse

customer_reviews.title: I bought this and liked it better then the old one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and liked it better then the old one. The buckle is definitely an improvement to the older fastener. I loved the purple color but it fell apart in a couple of months. they replaced it with a blue one. not the color I wanted but they refused to give me the purple, Now the blue one is doing the same thing only more so. I'm at home most of the time and not hard on these at all. Just don't get why they come apart. It must be a flaw in the way they are put together or cheap material.. disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: Super-shopper

customer_reviews.title: I've lost weight!!! Yay!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have lost 14 pounds since putting my fitbit on about 45 days ago. I log all my food with the app and I use it to make sure I get at least 10,000 steps a day and fulfill the other 'goals:' 10 staircases a day, 2,600 calories burned, 5 miles travelled, 30 active minutes, 64 oz of water, and 8 hours of sleep. I have done other programs to lose weight, but I think part of my success with this is that I have a constant reminder on my wrist that I've got work to do!
customer_reviews.author: Middle o Nowhere

customer_reviews.title: Wristband and battery are junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk, don’t waste your money on Fitbit products. They do not hold up or last. Wristband bubbles up and comes apart. Battery does not last. I only used mine a total of 4 months and the battery will no longer hold a charger. Only lasts about 10 hours. Fitbit will not repair or replace once warranty is up. They have no repair service outside of warranty so you are stuck with a worthless piece of garbage. Never ever will I buy Fitbit. Better off with a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Todd S. Levick

customer_reviews.title: The UA app is flashier but not as useful.
customer_reviews.text: Measure your wrist first! A small is really small. If you're not sure, a large will probably do. Pros: Measures my steps accurately when compared to other pedometers Can't vouch for accuracy of heart rate but it matches the treadmill's rate Integrates really well with MyFitnessPal and Rally as well as a lot of other fitness apps out there Cons: Watch function can't be on all the time Not waterproof Compared to UA Band the HR: is much much easier to read. has a more accurate step count measures heart rate all the time, not just at certain points. I also prefer the Fitbit app. The UA app is flashier but not as useful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motivating
customer_reviews.text: This is much more interesting that I thought it would be. Over time the dashboard shows trends and improvements in activity. The interactive challenges are quite motivating. I use a lot of power tools; reciprocating saws, sanders, oscillating tools. I would have thought these would really throw the steps off but this seems to be able to tell the difference and just count 'steps'. The only upgrade I would like to see is a better charging connection. With my poor eyesight I cannot really tell which way to insert the charging connector. I am sure I have dinged this up as a result.
customer_reviews.author: JVM

product_meta.title: Fitbit Charge HR Wireless Activity Wristband (Black, Large (6.2 - 7.6 in))
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Size:LargeMake every beat count with Charge HR—an advanced activity wristband that gives you automatic, continuous heart rate tracking right on your wrist—all day, during workouts and beyond. Check heart rate 24/7 to maximize training, maintain exercise intensity and measure calorie burn. Automatically track your all-day activity, exercise and sleep, and stay connected with call notifications on display. By wirelessly syncing stats and trends to your smartphone and computer, Charge HR gives you the motivation you need to push yourself further—every step, every beat, every day.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
• Certain features like Auto Sleep Tracking and SmartTrack may be disabled when using this accessory. Classic accessory bands are the recommended accessory for high intensity workouts and sleep tracking. • Do not wear the Flex 2 Pendant accessory while sleeping or during high intensity activity, as doing so could create a choking hazard. • Flex 2 Pendant accessories contain magnets. Magnets may interfere with pacemakers, defibrillators, or other medical devices. Consult your physician and the manufacturer of your medical device before using to determine if these accessories are safe for you. If the accessories may be interfering with your pacemaker, defibrillator, or other medical device, do not wear the accessories.

BUYING GUIDE
Move it up: Since blood increases further up your arm, wear your tracker higher on your wrist to improve the heart rate signal during workouts. Start by moving the device up to three finger widths above your wrist bone, then experiment with slightly lower placement. Keep it secure: The less your tracker moves during exercise, the more chance you have of maintaining a heart rate signal throughout the activity. Do not wear the band too tightly, as this can restrict blood flow and goes against our wear and care guidelines. Hold steady for ten seconds: High intensity exercises or activities that cause you to keep your wrist bent (like push-ups) or move your arms vigorously (like dance) may interfere with heart rate signals. If you stop seeing a signal during these types of activities, hold your wrist steady for ten seconds during breaks to get your reading.
